skill.name: clickup-integration-expert
skill.description: When the user asks about ClickUp synchronization or syncing roadmaps with ClickUp
skill.summary: When the user asks about ClickUp synchronization or syncing roadmaps with ClickUp
skill.author: AndresNaza

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only contains documentation about ClickUp integration patterns and MCP usage. No file access, network calls, or command execution capabilities. Static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misidentifying documentation formatting and JSON examples as security patterns.

content.value_statement: Manual roadmap-to-ClickUp synchronization is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides expert guidance on using the ClickUp MCP for bidirectional sync between local planning files and ClickUp tasks.
actual_capabilities: Provide guidance on ClickUp MCP setup and authentication
Explain sync mapping between local epics/milestones and ClickUp tasks/subtasks
Describe command usage for setup, push, pull, and full sync operations
Recommend best practices for conflict resolution between local and remote states
limitations: This is a guidance skill only - it does not execute sync operations itself
Requires the ClickUp MCP server to be installed and configured separately
Does not handle authentication - users must complete OAuth flow via /mcp command

use_cases.title: Plan and Track Roadmaps
use_cases.description: Maintain strategic roadmaps locally while keeping ClickUp tasks synchronized for team execution.

use_cases.title: Coordinate Epic Deliverables
use_cases.description: Define epics and milestones in planning files and push them to ClickUp for developer task breakdown.

use_cases.title: Bridge Planning and Execution
use_cases.description: Keep planning documents authoritative while using ClickUp for sprint-level task management.

prompt_templates.title: Setup ClickUp Sync
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I set up ClickUp synchronization for my roadmap? What MCP commands do I need?

prompt_templates.title: Push Changes to ClickUp
prompt_templates.prompt: I made changes to my local epics. How do I push them to ClickUp without overwriting remote work?

prompt_templates.title: Resolve Sync Conflicts
prompt_templates.prompt: What happens when my local roadmap and ClickUp have conflicting changes? How are conflicts resolved?

prompt_templates.title: Link Items Manually
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I manually link a local milestone to an existing ClickUp task that was created outside the sync?

output_examples.input: How do I sync my local roadmap to ClickUp for the first time?
output: 1. Install ClickUp MCP: claude mcp add --transport http clickup https://mcp.clickup.com/mcp
3. Run /clickup-sync:setup to configure workspace, space, and folder mappings
4. Run /clickup-sync:push to create epics and milestones as tasks
Tip: Pull before push to get any existing remote changes first

output_examples.input: What are the sync commands available?
output: Push: /clickup-sync:push - Send local changes to ClickUp

output_examples.input: How do conflicts get resolved during sync?
output: Status conflicts: ClickUp version wins (reflects current state)
Point conflicts: Local version wins (planning authority)
Title conflicts: Local version wins (planning authority)
Tip: Pull changes before pushing to minimize conflicts

best_practices: Pull changes from ClickUp before pushing local changes to avoid overwriting team updates
Use dry-run mode when available to preview sync operations before executing them
Check sync status regularly to identify issues early before they compound
anti_patterns: Pushing without pulling first - this can overwrite remote changes made by team members
Manually editing ClickUp tasks that were created via sync without using the sync tool
Skipping the initial setup step - improper configuration leads to duplicate tasks

faq.question: Does this skill work with self-hosted ClickUp instances?
faq.answer: ClickUp MCP connects to cloud ClickUp. Self-hosted requires checking if your instance supports API access.

faq.question: What happens to my data during sync?
faq.answer: Sync creates tasks in your ClickUp space. Local files remain unchanged. No data is sent to third parties.

faq.question: Can multiple team members use sync on the same roadmap?
faq.answer: Yes, but coordinate to avoid conflicts. Pull before push and communicate changes to your team.

faq.question: How are conflicts between local and ClickUp resolved?
faq.answer: Status defaults to ClickUp (current state). Points and titles default to local (planning authority).

faq.question: What permissions does ClickUp MCP require?
faq.answer: OAuth grants access to workspaces you authorize. MCP only accesses data you explicitly select.

faq.question: How is this different from other ClickUp integrations?
faq.answer: This skill works with the official ClickUp MCP for Claude Code, enabling bidirectional sync with local markdown roadmaps.
